tva:BasicDescription.tva:Title: Clint Eastwood Speech, Invisible Obama
tva:BasicDescription.tva:Synopsis: "It seems doubtful that Clint Eastwood made Mitt Romney's day with his speech during the Republican National Convention on Thursday. The acclaimed actor and director, who is 82, turned out to be the much-touted "mystery guest" the Romney campaign teased this week. But rather than delivering a clear endorsement of Romney, the actor used an empty chair to stand in for President Barack Obama onstage at the RNC, and then questioned the invisible POTUS about his policies and positions...".* The Young Turks host Cenk Uygur breaks it down. *Read more here from Max Zimbert on Yahoo: news.yahoo.com

tva:HowRelated.tva:Definition: The reference points to a resource recommended the provider of the current resource. tva:Review.tva:FreeTextReview: I did think about it. It makes more sense if George Bush was in that chair as he is a Republican nd would be able to publicly give his endorsement to Romney and Ryan. It was pure pandering to blame someone and not give genuine solutions﻿ to our problems without gutting the lives of the American people.

guys leave him alone hes 82 years old! he probably sometimes still thinks hes a detective looking for missing girls while blowing people away with﻿ a .44 Magnum! xD no but honestly I think he was trolling everyone at that convention xDD
This is funny﻿ - I like the absurdity of it...
neither do i you retard. your simple﻿ mind blown yet?

Guess what, it doesn't matter what job title an american has, he still not only has every right, but duty to be politiacally active in some way. If we aren't it will﻿ lead to tyrany which is what we are begining to see today, And I understand what you're saying, but I think you are missing the larger problem here. And that is the corporate funds that go in and out of these campaigns. These are the ones in control. until that's fixed everything else is irrelivant -- attack the root cause
Wow, you are dumb... first off, you stumbled and fumbled as much as he did in your own video that you﻿ CAN EDIT....

You are 18 and you are saying that someone who has many years on you has no right to stand up and voice his opinion on something? Ok well I am almost thirty and I can smell a dipshit a mile away and buddy, you reek. Have you ever seen the movie Idiocracy? Watch it. It is your own personal﻿ anthem.
wouldn't it be great to see obama do the opposite to this routine where he talks to invisible clint eastwood.... AND tells him and﻿ romney to go f**k themselves...
Lol you couldn't blow my mind with dynamite son you just don't have the intellectual capacity.﻿
Most﻿ politicians are actors.

They would've put him up here because an influential/famous actor. If they have a popular person speaking on their behalf, that can gain them support.
Reguardless, Clint Eastwood has been invovled politics since the mid-eighties when he was elected mayor﻿ for one term. But yes, he hasn't dedicated his life to politics.
The man is 82, like my dad would say he's﻿ living on borrowed time, give him a break.
Clint is a bad ass, he's﻿ Clint Eastwood. Dude rocks no matter what.

Poor Clint. Perhaps at his advanced age, and not using any notes he really has lost it. Obviously, Barack H. Obama is not invisible,﻿ as he has been spotted playing golf on over 100 courses since he became "President".
Clint did﻿ ok..
You should be proud of this. He's a freakin' genius!! ﻿ Think about it LOL
To be﻿ fair﻿ to Clint Eastwood here: Nobody knows Mitt Romney's positions. Especially not Mitt Romney himself.

its because the elites know that most of americans are fucking retards and only people like celebrities would we be able to understand. if politicians really get down to the needy gritty issues, people would be like﻿ wtf is he talking about?!??!? this is boring! turn dancing with the celebrities back on! america is a joke, the whole system is crumbling, us younger generations are screwed
I'm sorry, but, come again?﻿
This is just dumb. lol.﻿
Akward silence. "What are all you fishheads﻿ lookin' at?" >:(
It's news discussion media, not a big time Youtuber. It'd be rediculous if they kept cutting the video.﻿
TYT took this﻿ a bit too serious

Reviewer.Movies: the die hards terminator 2 scarface all the rockys all the adam sandler films
Reviewer.Music: lil wayne kanye west snoop dog jay z linken park taylor swift green day kings of leon and a lot more

Reviewer.Books: anything Heinlein, History, Philosophy, Astronomy, Design
Reviewer.Movies: ZEITGEIST anything from quentin tarantino, The Matrix,LOR, Absolutely Fabulous, the Fkn' Newz, Star Trek
Reviewer.Music: allmost all except for most rap, love ska, punk, psychobilly, folk, industrial

Reviewer.Movies: I like many films, but mainly the classics.
Reviewer.Music: Queen, Freddie Mercury, The Beatles, Frank Sinatra, The Rat Pack and many more.

Reviewer.Hometown: Ultra liberal & sanctuary city, Arlington County, VA.

Reviewer.Books: LOR, The River (Edward Hooper).... you know what i mean!!.. WWII history, more to follow..
Reviewer.Movies: BBM, Spiderman (all), Batman (all), Cosmos, Richard Dawkins,
Reviewer.Music: Jackson Brown, James Taylor, east coast, opera, C&W, Linda Ronstad, Elton John

Reviewer.Books: anything Heinlein, History, Philosophy, Astronomy, Design
Reviewer.Movies: ZEITGEIST anything from quentin tarantino, The Matrix,LOR, Absolutely Fabulous, the Fkn' Newz, Star Trek
Reviewer.Music: allmost all except for most rap, love ska, punk, psychobilly, folk, industrial

Reviewer.Books: Robinson Crusoe, My Brother Sam is Dead, and many more, I just cant remember it all.
Reviewer.Movies: To many to count. I really like the movie Legends of the Fall, great movie! Planet of the Apes. Starwars. Serenity. Every genre except for comedy, why? Well, comedy is just not funny to me, it doesnt grab my attention like others.
Reviewer.Music: Rock, techno, trance. Actually pretty much everything really, although country I do not like very much. Mainly just techno and trance.

Reviewer.Books: The Dexter Series. Series of Unfortunate Events.
Reviewer.Movies: Lucky Number Slevin, Dexter, The Twilight Zone (the old ones)
Reviewer.Music: Watch my guitar covers... That'll give you an idea.

Reviewer.Books: What the heck is a book?
Reviewer.Movies: A Clockwork fuggin Orange, The Dark Knight & All Tarantino films! Fight Club ...uhh all Fincher flicks, Trainspotting, Boyz N The Hood, Goodfellas and Taxi Driver..umm crap. Toy Story, Across the Universe, Road to Perdition, Sin City, Forrest Gump, Saving Private Ryan, Elf, Family Guy,FLCL,Battle Royale, and,I am Legend Shawshank Redemtion,Green Mile and blah blah blah..oh and Donnie Darko!
